result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E. Henyard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*    Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with anyone who traffics or uses drugs, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Women's Horizons counseling.  Contact w/ Cassi M as determined by DOC.

timeConds.notes:
Huber Allowed.
***STAYED***
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is elegible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
from Kimberly Rossi of Women and Children's Horizons

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C. Rose.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Victim present and addressed the court.  Court withholds sentence and places the deft on probation for 18 months with conditions.  Court stays 6 months conditional jail with Huber privileges.  No contact with anyone who traffics or uses drugs.  Contact with Cassi Maclin as determined by DOC. Deft to pay $250.00 DNA surcharge and $100.00 DV surcharge.  Credit for 2 days served if revoked.  Bond applied to costs, any remainder to be returned to poster.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C. Rose.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Atty Rose requests to adjourn SEH as he just received the PSI today.  SEH adjourned to 6/13/16 @ 2:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  On State's motion, cts 2, 3 & 4 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 5/23/16 at 1:30pm.  ADA Delgado states the victim would like no contact condition of bond amended.  Court will not modify bond until deft starts treatment.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
With ADA Delgado and Atty Rose the FPT of 1/20/16 at 8:45am is rescheduled to 3/1/16, DA PTC set for 2/19/16 at 1:30pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Defendant, Michael E. Henyard, appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:45 am.
